etymology.description: 屮(屮) (chè, "sprout") x3 = abundant plant growth -> plants, flowers, vegetation
etymology.interpretation: The character 卉(卉) (huì, "plant") combines three occurrences of 屮(屮) (chè, "sprout"), which visually conveys the concept of numerous sprouts or abundant vegetation, emphasizing the idea of plant life flourishing.

examples.chinese: 这座植物园里有丰富的卉(這座植物園裡有豐富的卉)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò zhíwùyuán lǐ yǒu fēngfù de huì.
examples.english: This botanical garden has abundant plants.

examples.chinese: 春天来临时(春天來臨時)，各种卉竞相开放(各種卉競相開放)。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān láilín shí, gèzhǒng huì jìngxīang kāifàng.
examples.english: When spring arrives, various plants bloom in competition.

examples.chinese: 古代文学中常用‘卉’来指代植物(古代文學中常用‘卉’來指代植物)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài wénxué zhōng cháng yòng ‘huì’ lái zhǐdài zhíwù.
examples.english: In ancient literature, '卉' is often used to represent plants.
